lead_paragraph: A federal judge ordered the deadline extended to Oct. 18 because of Hurricane Matthew, siding with voting rights advocates and the state Democratic Party.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Alan Blinder contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Florida Voter Registration Extended After Storm
headline.main: Florida Voter Registration Deadline Is Extended, a Win for Democrats

snippet: A federal judge ordered the deadline extended to Oct. 18 because of Hurricane Matthew, siding with voting rights advocates and the state Democratic Party....
abstract: Federal Judge Mark Walker extends Florida's voter registration deadline by seven days; Democratic Party and League of Women Voters successfully argued extension is needed because damage from Hurricane Matthew could impede last-minute voter registration and sued Gov Rick Scott after he refused; lawyers for state Democrats say final-week registrants tend to be young or minorities, two heavily Democratic groups.
